intro: Erigeron × raddeanus, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a hybrid perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its silvery-blue foliage and clusters of small, daisy-like white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many common garden flowers such as daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for native gardens and pollinator habitats.
